title: Exhaustive Procedure for LOgic-Rule Extraction (EXPLORE)
text: Functions find short accurate decision rule disjunctive normal form using Exhaustive Procedure LOgic-Rule Extraction (EXPLORE) algorithm. application performs exhaustive search Boolean Normal Form decision rules.

title: Exhaustive Procedure for LOgic-Rule Extraction (EXPLORE)
text: can install latest version EXPLORE like : Additional instructions: added.

title: Exhaustive Procedure for LOgic-Rule Extraction (EXPLORE)
text: Load data: Fit model defaults /input parameters: Predict: Additional documentation includes: - Vignette code examples combination PLP: added - Package manual: added
code: library(Explore) library(farff) data <- farff::readARFF(system.file("examples/iris.arff", package = "Explore")) output_path <- file.path(getwd(), "output//") model <- Explore::trainExplore(output_path = output_path,                                 file_name = "iris",                                 train_data = data,                                 ClassFeature = "'class'",                                 PositiveClass = '"Iris-versicolor"') prediction <- Explore::predictExplore(model, test_data = data)

title: Writes settings in a table for Explore — settingsExplore
code: settingsExplore(   settings,   output_path,   file_name,   train_data = NULL,   OutputFile = NULL,   StartRulelength = 1,   EndRulelength = 3,   OperatorMethod = "EXHAUSTIVE",   CutoffMethod = NULL,   ClassFeature,   PositiveClass,   FeatureInclude = "",   Maximize = "ACCURACY",   Accuracy = 0,   Specificity = 0,   PrintSettings = "yes",   PrintPerformance = "yes",   Subsumption = "yes",   BranchBound = "yes",   Parallel = "no" )

title: Writes settings in a table for Explore — settingsExplore
text: settings Settings parameter output_path string declaring path settings file_name string declaring path file name train_data Train data OutputFile string declaring path output file StartRulelength Positive integer EndRulelength Positive integer OperatorMethod One list strings, e.g. list = "EXHAUSTIVE", ... CutoffMethod One list strings, list = "RVAC", ... ClassFeature String, name one columns data train. PositiveClass 1 string (?) (one elements column 'ClassFeature' data train) FeatureInclude Empty string (name one columns data train) Maximize One list strings, list = "ACCURACY", ... Accuracy Float 0-1 -> default = 0 (0, make empty = computationally beneficial) Specificity float 0-1, default = 0 PrintSettings True False PrintPerformance True False Subsumption True False BranchBound True False Parallel True False

what: Finds decision rule using Explore — trainExplore
title: Finds decision rule using Explore — trainExplore
text: `trainExplore()` finds best decision rule given data set based using EXPLORE.

title: Finds decision rule using Explore — trainExplore
code: trainExplore(   train_data = NULL,   settings_path = NULL,   output_path = tempdir(),   file_name = "train_data",   OutputFile = NULL,   StartRulelength = 1,   EndRulelength = 3,   OperatorMethod = "EXHAUSTIVE",   CutoffMethod = "RVAC",   ClassFeature = "'class'",   PositiveClass = "'Iris-versicolor'",   FeatureInclude = "",   Maximize = "ACCURACY",   Accuracy = 0,   Specificity = 0,   PrintSettings = TRUE,   PrintPerformance = TRUE,   Subsumption = TRUE,   BranchBound = TRUE,   Parallel = FALSE )

title: Finds decision rule using Explore — trainExplore
text: train_data Train data settings_path string declaring path settings output_path string declaring path settings file_name string declaring path file name OutputFile string declaring path output file StartRulelength Positive integer EndRulelength Positive integer OperatorMethod One list strings, e.g. list = "EXHAUSTIVE", ... CutoffMethod One list strings, list = "RVAC", ... ClassFeature String, name one columns data train. Always provided user. string enclused single quotation marks, e.g. 'class' PositiveClass 1 string (?) (one elements column 'ClassFeature' data train). Always provided user. string enclused single quotation marks, e.g. 'class' FeatureInclude Empty string (name one columns data train) Maximize One list strings, list = "ACCURACY", ... Accuracy Float 0-0.999 -> default = 0 (0, make empty = computationally beneficial) Specificity float 0-0.999, default = 0 PrintSettings True False PrintPerformance True False Subsumption True False BranchBound True False Parallel True False
